TopicTitle: Ask the Mods questions about the Forums!

Articles.Content:
> 
> 
> 1 minute ago, CatastrophicFailure said:
> 
> 
> Unless we get any Smurfs... ![<_<](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_dry.png "<_<")
> 

We only deal with little green men here, not little blue ones...  that's why they 'hired' me... to keep the blues ones out.  ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)")

> 
> 
> 2 hours ago, Gargamel said:
> 
> 
> We only deal with little green men here, not little blue ones...  that's why they 'hired' me... to keep the blues ones out.  ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)")
> 

Ahem, I had a terrible crush on Smurfette as a young lad.

Pistols at dawn?

> 
> 
> On 1/19/2019 at 1:58 AM, CatastrophicFailure said:
> 
> 
> How many notifications in total, on average? Are we talking scientific notation, here?
> 

Being the new guy on the team, I'm still adjusting how I get notifications.   I had 70 some today alone.  It took me about 4 hours to go through the forums to read and respond to all the threads I wanted to as a player.

This could use an update. ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)")

<iframe allowfullscreen="" data-controller="core.front.core.autosizeiframe" data-embedcontent="" data-embedid="embed7190422248" scrolling="no" src="https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/74320-your-moderators/&do=embed" style="height:228px;max-width:502px;"></iframe>

I just got a notification about a reaction on one of my posts but after clicking on the bell, it was gone o\_O So, does a notification disappear if someone removes the reaction?  

I've seen the name of the forum user in the little window which pops up in the lower left window of my screen but no chance to find out which post got the reaction since it is in a thread where I have several posts but all of them are already a few days/weeks old...

> 
> 
> 9 minutes ago, 4x4cheesecake said:
> 
> 
> I just got a notification about a reaction on one of my posts but after clicking on the bell, it was gone o\_O So, does a notification disappear if someone removes the reaction?  
> 
> I've seen the name of the forum user in the little window which pops up in the lower left window of my screen but no chance to find out which post got the reaction since it is in a thread where I have several posts but all of them are already a few days/weeks old...
> 

Check your notification now. Do you see a "like" on this post?

> 
> 
> 1 minute ago, cubinator said:
> 
> 
> Check your notification now. Do you see a "like" on this post?
> 

Nope, just one for the quote.

I assume you liked/unliked it? ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)")

Thanks for testing though ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")
How long is it between replies that your post gets merged with a previous one?

Liking then unliking a post can result in a notification being sent. 

Automerging is set to 10 minutes.

> 
> 
> 1 minute ago, Vanamonde said:
> 
> 
> Liking then unliking a post can result in a notification being sent. 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Automerging is set to 10 minutes.
> 

Thank you! 

> 
> 
> 1 minute ago, Vanamonde said:
> 
> 
> set
> 

Makes it sound like it can be changed. Can it?

> 
> 
> 38 minutes ago, 4x4cheesecake said:
> 
> 
> Nope, just one for the quote.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> I assume you liked/unliked it? ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)")
> 
> 
> 
> Thanks for testing though ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")
> 

Yes. I suspect that if something happens in between, for instance if I liked the post, then quoted it, then unliked it, then the notification would not disappear.
Yes, the automerge timer can be changed. But why would we want to?

[@Vanamonde](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/27914-vanamonde/), What is this user: [@Noah Masur](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/185892-noah-masur/)

I've not seen any red titles until now.
[@The Dunatian](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/173591-the-dunatian/) He's a forum admin.

Some images, including my own in both the actual post and in the editing box^TM^, simply don't showw while some others do.  

Am I the only one with this right now?

> 
> 
> 2 hours ago, Delay said:
> 
> 
> Some images, including my own in both the actual post and in the editing box^TM^, simply don't showw while some others do.  
>   
> 
> Am I the only one with this right now?
> 

What is the hosting service and technical stuff like that?

> 
> 
> 3 hours ago, Delay said:
> 
> 
> Some images, including my own in both the actual post and in the editing box^TM^, simply don't showw while some others do.  
>   
> 
> Am I the only one with this right now?
> 

ctrl-shift-f5 or ctrl-shift-r on most browsers will force a reload of everything. I expect your cache is wonky.

**Edited <time datetime="2019-02-01T20:18:04Z" title="02/01/2019 08:18  PM" data-short="5 yr">February 1, 2019</time> by 5thHorseman**

So I just noticed a lot of moderators on ~~/r/Kerbal\_Space\_Program/~~ /r/KerbalSpaceProgram...

Er, I was just going to ask how much you guys interacted with the reddit mods, but then I literally just discovered there's two KSP forums, not including r/krpc, /r/KSP\_Missions, and /r/ksptrickshots...

So do you guys mix with reddit at all? Or is it just the Wild West over there and you try not to look at the carnage?
A couple of our guys are also Steam moderators, but no Reddit mods here.
I’ve seen a couple of mods in the Addon Releases section with red tags before their names saying something like ‘parts’. What’s up with those? Are they the remnants of an attempt to categorise mods?

> 
> 
> 6 hours ago, RealKerbal3x said:
> 
> 
> I’ve seen a couple of mods in the Addon Releases section with red tags before their names saying something like ‘parts’. What’s up with those? Are they the remnants of an attempt to categorise mods?
> 

Sal\_vager knew the alchemical secret of making colorful tags, but alas, he did not pass on his secrets before departing the forum. I suspect you're seeing a relic of olden times.

> 
> 
> 14 hours ago, Vanamonde said:
> 
> 
> Sal\_vager knew the alchemical secret of making colorful tags, but alas, he did not pass on his secrets before departing the forum. I suspect you're seeing a relic of olden times.
> 

The dark side of the Force is a pathway to many abilities some consider to be unnatural...

When did [@adsii1970](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/89014-adsii1970/) become a mod?? ![:blink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_blink.png ":blink:")

I always thought he was perpetually under the ban hammer...

>

> When did [@adsii1970](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/89014-adsii1970/) become a mod?? ![:blink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_blink.png ":blink:")

You know, it was back in January...

No, not perpetually under the ban hammer - just under the warning hammer. I often joke they made me a moderator as a means to FORCE me to behave better... ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D")
I never realized that as well. Just to make you better about yourself, [@CatastrophicFailure](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/57438-catastrophicfailure/).
